Creators.ConcatDisplayName: Master of the Arcetri Altarpiece (Italian, active 1450-1475)

CreditLine: Acquired by Henry Walters with the Massarenti Collection, 1902
Description: For more information on this piece, please see Federico Zeri's 1976 catalogue number 553, pp. 90-91.
Dimensions: H with frame: 37 15/16 x W: 36 1/4 x D: 13/16 in. (96.4 x 92 x 2 cm); Center panel painted surface H: 19 13/16 x W: 15 7/16 in. (50.3 x 39.2 cm); Left wing painted surface H: 20 7/8 x W: 9 1/16 in. (53.1 x 23 cm); Right wing painted surface H: 20 7/8 x W: 8 5/8 in. (53.1 x 21.9 cm)

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: God's Minstrel: St. Francis of Assisi
Exhibitions.Textblock: God's Minstrel: St. Francis of Assisi. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1982.

Inscriptions: [Transcription] On central panel, under lunette (Virginis should read Virgo): MATER MARIA · VIRGINIS · ORA · P [RO] NOBIS
Provenance: Marquess Filippo Marignoli, Rome and Spoleto, until 1898 [mode of acquisition unknown]; Marquess Francesco Marignoli, 1898 [mode of acquisition unknown]; Don Marcello Massarenti Collection, Rome, 1899 [mode of acquisition unknown] [1900 catalogue supplement: no. 4, as Pietro Lorenzetti]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1902, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints
